ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: No TA

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 1 I would have appreciated having the book title submitted to the campus book stores so that it could be bought locally rather than having to wait for delivery by post. Since the reading load was heavy and the book took a couple of weeks to arrive, it took me several weeks to get caught up with the readings.
Listening to Prof. robinson describe the evolution of international environmental laws. he is a treasure trove of historical information! I loved his lectures!

The instructor was very knowledgeable about all aspects of law taught in the course, and provided a very good overview of the material that was easy to follow regardless of the students' previous background. I really appreciated the instructor's teaching method and thought the course is a must for all MEM students.
The professor. Professor Nicholas Robinson is a great lecturer. His 40+ years of international environmental law experience are an invaluable resource for students.
Professor Robinson was extremely knowledgable and genuinely interested in teaching the course and talking to students.
Professor Robinson's lectures
The lectures of the professor were amazing. The professor is very knowledgeable and experienced in his field and he can teach you in 3 hours things that others need 3 months.
The best thing about the class was the teaching. Prof. Robinson knows a lot and a lot about what he is teaching.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I don't think the course needs improvement.

The only thing I would change about this course is the clarity to which the midterm and final exam questions were written. I spent hours upon hours deciphering what questions the professor was actually asking. This exercise was helpful in crafting an argument - up until a point.
I don't think that anything needs improvement.
The instructor uses the board instead of PowerPoint presentation. That is very cumbersome to follow and to take and keep notes.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The instructor was very responsive to questions and always made time for his students.

The professor was always available to answer student's questions in either a group or individual setting. He has even offered to review his comments on our final papers next semester. It is apparent throughout the course that Professor Robinson truly cares about his students and their connection with a topic that might (or might not) be brand new to them.

Professor Robinson made himself available during class breaks and after class to answer student questions. Since he has so much experience in the field of international environmental law and knows so many others involved in such work, he always has interesting anecdotes and examples to share. This was truly an invaluable asset for learning the material.
The professor was always responsive and helpful.
The instructor was always available. He has no TA, and I feel that won't be useful to have one.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I'm interested in international environmental agreements, so this is perfect for understanding them.

I think this is a course every MEM student should take, and I took it because I wanted to have a solid background in international environmental law, which is more interesting to me as an international student compared to other courses taught at FES that deal with US environmental law.

I never seriously thought about going to into the international environmental law field. After this course, I am seriously considering it. If that doesn't say how good the class is I don't know what else would.
I'm interested in environmental policy and since I don't have any law background I wanted to gain some knowledge on international environmental law.
This course fits entirely into my program that is focused in climate change and international governance.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See above.
See answer to Question 17.
I enrolled in this course to gain a better understanding of environmental diplomacy and law.
General interest in obtaining a broader base of knowledge of international environmental governance.
To gain some knowledge on international environmental law.
I took this course in order to bolster my skills in international law and to complement the courses that I took in international governance.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.

It surpassed my expectations, and was one of the most enjoyable and instructive courses I have taken at FES. It got me more interested in the subject of environmental law, whichI intend to pursue further in the future.
Most definitely!
YES!
YES!
Yes, it did.
It lives up my expectations partially. The content was too broad and we end up rounding up rather than emphasizing on the most critical issues of the international law of our time.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
See answer to Question 17.
I am so glad that I took this course this fall.
Yes.
I met my expectations partially since we missedto focus on some issues I will love to be taught about.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Definitely take this course (and with this instructor) if you want a good overview of international negotiations and environmental lawmaking.
The papers in this course will take a long time to prepare. DO NOT DELAY. Even though you think you might have a good amount of time to read, write, and prepare them, you will need every single day.

If you plan to take the course, order the text book ASAPand keep up with the readings. Take advantage of Professor Robinson's extensive knowledge of the subject and his interest in talking to students.
Don't take the course if you don't like writing long essays.
For students taking this class, I will advise them just to read a lot instead of relying of the lecture.
